review_title: Sofa Surfing Streams of Cinema on Small Screens In The Summer of 2024
review_detailed_main:
It's bad. It is. But it's hard to tell why, and then at times, its weakness plays in its favor, weirdly. Like, a kind of it's so bad it's good kind of vibe. And you can't blame all the actors that showed up here. You can almost get it and understand why.

Even the bit actors are instantly and totally recognizable at first sight. Like you've seen them a million times before in a million other movies.

Like, who wouldn't want to be in this?

A space comedy with Eddie Murphy at the turn of the century.

Written by the guy who wrote Hocus Pocus and Mystery Men.

And directed by the guy who made City Slickers. Heart and Souls and Tremors.

So what happened?

I really have no idea.

I know getting stuff from the page to the screen is difficult.

To look right.

And I can't tell if the movie looks this way because so many others do from this era or it's a lack of funds.

And Rosario Dawson just seems too young to be a love interest or if any interest to Murphy's character.

That doesn't work either.

I've always had a morbid curiosity to see this film, even when it was out.

It definitely plumbs the depths.

It's not a good movie.

But I sort of like it anyway.

The way it looks.

The horrible acting from just about all involved.

This movie suffers the most from identity conflict.

It just doesn't know what it wants to be.

A comedy, you would think.

But it also wants to be some sci-fi thriller which seems totally strange.

But it should be viewed just for that.

Because it is so bizarre.. I can't look away.

review_title: Not Gritty. Not Goofy. A little creative. Mostly Average
review_detailed_main:
It's not that bad, but it's definitely lacking. They have a great cast, many familiar faces. I found this the most uplifting part of the movie. So the question is, why is it so bad with such a good cast? It lacks in emotions, jokes and all around a mind blowing plot. Everything about it hits the average wheel. For being on Mars in the future they should have had more cool technology. More creativity. The plot is down right simple. You can tell they were trying to go for a Fifth Element, Total Recall, Judge Dredd feel, but the movie lacked in the creativity those films had.

The movie is still fun. And Eddie Murphy is great as always. Lots of good faces. And there are a few jokes that might make you chuckle. I loved the robot guy. He was my favorite character in the whole thing. The only one with a memorable personality. And the robot jokes were awesome. But overall the movie is very simple, very toned down for a futuristic film Not a lot to it. They toned Eddie Murphy and his funniness down too much. And didn't give the gorgeous Dina Lake much of a role. Not much grit to it and not cheesy enough to be a comedy.

Good watch, might watch again, and can recommend.

It's a little silly, but it's fine for an action comedy. The only weird thing, really was setting on Luna. Having on the its moon instead of on Terra didn't really add a lot to the movie except to facilitate a flimsy backstory and some scenes where people required environmental suits, and that had little payoff.

The benefits of being a sci-fi action comedy is to have laser effects for the blasters, and androids, which are used to various levels of humor.

Eddie Murphy is great, and he plays well with Rosario Dawson, and if nothing else, you have to admit Randy Quaid is funny: the character would have been much different in someone else's hands. I'll have to admit I thought it was Terry O'Quinn ("Lost": John Locke), which made even funnier at the time, but it's a good job done.

Honestly, Eddie Murphy and Rosario Dawson feel a little big for their roles, but the story is good: a former smuggler turns legitimate business owner has to find the mob boss behind the people trying to kill him.

While I do think this is an average movie, it is solid, and I don't think I would go changing a lot to it. I could see a couple versions of a reboot, but in 2020, they'd probably put it in the MCU.

I didn't know anything about this film, but I was like "Eddy Murphy?, this can't go wrong. But it can! Next time save money on names and stars and invest in scripts, directing, vision and schwung. In the mean time, watch "coming to America" yet again and discover new layers off brilliance.

I don't get it. Why did Eddie Murphy's "The Adventures of Pluto Nash" get so much beat up? I see the screenplay is thin, but anyway I think they managed to make this a great movie with some beautiful special effects. I've seen A LOT of movies in my life time, and I've definitely seen much more worse comedies than this, ex. WILD WILD WEST, BOWFINGER and BOAT TRIP (not that there is any comparison).

It is GREAT that there is no dick-, tit- and most of all Uranus jokes, the humor is much more sophisticated and sarcastic. By the way, Eddie Murphy does a SUPERB acting job, he is real and sympathetic.

Unfortunately this movie has been a huge fiasco worldwide, which means that we most likely never get a sequel :-( Whatever the critics say about this movie, I say "JOB WELL DONE!!!".
After seeing the reviews I put off watching for year only to be surprised by a very enjoyable show.
This is garbage.. I feel bad for Eddie Murphy. I used to like Eddie Murphy's films, but this just seems like meh..... do it for the money.
The movie is fun and funny. Is it award winning no. But it's better than the ratings I've seen

review_title: I loved every second of it (this is not a typo)
review_detailed_main:
You can stop rubbing your eyes now, this is not a typo. Sure, The Adventures of Pluto Nash is a notorious bomb, a devastating box office debacle and a frequently bashed film in general. But guess what? I loved every second of it.

Call me a masochist, but sometime during mid to late 2003 I decided to locate and watch all of this decades' biggest cinematic flops  just to see if they were really that bad, or perhaps they were just poorly released with zero studio back up. After literally puking my guts out upon watching such horrors like Battlefield Earth (ugh) or Gigli (barf), I finally stumbled upon the Summer 2002 misfire that is Eddie Murphy's The Adventures of Pluto Nash. What I feared would become another celluloid travesty at first, slowly turned out to be a fun, campy and harmless sci-fi ride, with neat special f/x, imaginative settings (you can easily notice that someone put a lot of thought into this) and hilarious dialogs all packed into one. So OK, it's hardly a masterpiece, but I oddly found myself watching it again and again, until I finally purchased the damn thing on DVD.

The playful plot is set in a future where man settles the moon, there we meet Pluto Nash (Eddie Murphy), a successful night club owner whose club is burnt down in flames. Determined to figure out who's sabotaging his business (and trying to make him take the fall), Nash embarks an across-the-moon adventure with the help of his loyal robot Bruno (Randy Quaid) and female protagonist, Dina (Rosario Dawson)  only to find out the startling truth behind the lunar mafia forces. Along the way, we also meet some wonderful actors in the likes of John Cleese, (the late) Peter Boyle, Joe Pantoliano, Jay Mohr, Luiz Guzman and others.

While you won't find a solid moral value at the end of the road  this film delivers the goods (and then some) on the pure old-fashioned entertainment field. If you give it a chance, you might easily find yourself humming "fly me to the moon" once the final credits start rolling.

review_title: Better Than The New Star Wars Trilogy !

review_detailed_main:
First of all, I am one of those people who heard the rumour about Murphy's "Pluto Nash" being a flop and a disaster from miles away. So I didn't go out and see it instantly. At some point though, I just had to see this, because I wanted to know how bad can it be then.

I was stunned. The movie was fast, had a quite cliche, but a working storyline, EXCELLENT sets and subtle humour here and there. This definetly ain't a comedy, if that's what you're looking for, but a full-scale oldskool adventure film! The theme music is kickin', and the sets and the whole movie is so colourful, you'd think it was actually made in France (Just watch i.e. Vidocq). It was like experiencing some mid-90's computergame in a movie.

I think Eddie did a good job in his role of Pluto Nash, other actors were also high quality, but perhaps a bit shaded by Eddie, not because he acted better, but because of more screen time. I love to see this movie over and over again, everytime I get happy when I've watched it, and everytime I feel like I've seen one of the greatest space-adventures ever. I highly recommend if you like cool characters, fast action and extremely nice sets.

(BTW: There was a MOMO logo on the moon, I'm 100% sure I saw it!)

review_title: Spectacular. Eddie Murphy is cool. Rosario Dawson is hot. Art direction and effects very good.
review_detailed_main:
Whatever this movie might lack in story, acting, or general depth, it makes up for with the bold and creative set design, art direction, effects and style. There is a lot to look at and appreciate. I was surprised as I knew nothing about this movie - I just rented the DVD on a whim.

I enjoyed it all thoroughly. It doesn't try to take itself too seriously. There is nothing wrong with the story or acting. Sure I could find negative things to say, but why bother? This is light entertainment. No morals, no thought provoking material - just a lunar-futuristic eye candy sometimes-funny movie.

There's laser guns, robots, hover-car chases, lunar landscapes, purple space suits, moon mafia, even a high-tech cabaret show. And to top it off, Eddie Murphy whose screen presence is undeniable. Much imagination has gone into this movie, and that's more than I can say for a lot of others.

My Vote: 7/10

review_title: This might be one of the biggest flops of all time but this isn't as bad as i thought it would be.
review_detailed_main:
In the future... people have been living in the moon for work for building cities, starting businesses and it is the only place, where the moon has legalized gambling. A smooth fast talking ex-con turned business man Pluto Nash (Eddie Murphy) owns one of the best clubs in the mood. When mysterious gangsters starts showing up to visit his club, who they wants to buy his successful nightclub turned it into a casino. When Pluto says no to these gangsters, now Pluto finds himself on the run along his out of date robot bodyguard (Randy Quaid) and an young woman wannabe singer (Rosario Dawson). Who been trying to kill him and the others, who are involved with him. Now Pluto has to find out why these gangsters wants to murder him before they find him.

Directed by Ron Underwood (City Slickers, Heart & Souls, Tremors) made an watchable, sci-fi/comedy/adventure that turned into one of the biggest flops in motion pictures history. The premise isn't bad but there's an lack of energy from the direction and the script that could have been better. Director Underwood manages to get a good cast like Joe Pantoliano, Jay Mohr, Luis Guzman, James Rehborn, Peter Boyle, Pam Grier and more. The supporting cast has little to do here expect for Quaid and a bit part by John Clesse have the best moments in the movie. Murphy has some good moments here, Dawson is extremely likable but the last act of the film is a major disappointment. It is probably why that this movie flopped. Special Visual Effects are a mixed bag here. If it had re-shoots and a better third act, this feature could have been saved. There's worst Eddie Murphy movies than this one. It is mostly for die-hard fans of Murphy's work. Alec Baldwin appears unbilled. (** ½/*****).

review_title: A funny no-brainer worthy of any evening at home with a six-pack
review_detailed_main:
I saw this for the first time while at home and with my fiancée. After reading all the reviews I was prepared for the worst. Much to my delight we were both giggling all the way through.

As a rental, Pluto Nash is actually a brilliant evenings bit of entertainment.

I can understand anyone who forked out to go to the pictures to see this, feeling a bit let down. Don't let the comments of these people put you off renting it, it is a helluva lot better than some of the titles I have been duped into renting by a flashy box cover!

I give it a 7*/10 for any wet and miserable evening when you want to have a giggle and switch off your brain at the same time.

"The Adventures of Pluto Nash" isn't the best movie Eddie Murphy ever made. It's little better than the standard classic science fiction B-movie. Still, I found it enjoyable, certainly not Eddie Murphy's worst. Sure, it's a silly movie, and the big talents featured (Murphy, John Cleese, etc.) deserved better. But it has its moments. I guess movies like "Pluto Nash" are just an acquired taste.

review_title: Was surprised that I actually liked this movie.
review_detailed_main: I was surprised that I actually liked this movie. I think it started when Randy Quaid came out as the antiquated robot bodyguard. I know this movie flopped but it is definately worth a watch. The movie is witty, surprisingly action packed, and all and all a intresting story line that throws you for a loop at the end.

review_title: NOT As Bad As Most People Say
review_detailed_main: Before I saw this movie, I read some of its reviews and they were not pretty. So, I walked into the movie theater with very low expectations, despite the fact that I am a huge Eddie Murphy fan. However, I came out of the movie theater feeling like I didn't waste my money. In my opinion, "Pluto Nash" is a very entertaining film. It has its funny moments. Enough that I would go see it again. It also has a very talented cast. Along with Murphy stars Randy Quaid, Rosario Dawson, Joe Pantoliano, Jay Mohr, Burt Young, Pam Grier, Alec Baldwin, and Peter Boyle to name a few. I would recommend that you go see it. It is a shame that this movie didn't receive a whole lot of promotion. Go to the theater and have a laugh with Pluto nash.

review_title: Far better than most make out
review_detailed_main: Having seen watched this film last night, with a preconception of an all out dodgy sci-fi comedy I was pleasantly surprised to find that 'Pluto Nash' was actually a good movie. Much better than I originally expected and far better than some of these other reviews make out. The jokes aren't all that crude, the acting isn't too bad, and there are some good action sequences. The visual effects and sets are very good. Very Bladerunner/Total Recall in style. If you haven't got anything to do for about 90 minutes, I suggest going to see this enjoyable futuristic, comedy romp. It will have you laughing, for all the right reasons.

review_title: Not bad if you haven't seen the trailers
review_detailed_main:
I'm so glad i bought this DVD site unseen, if i had seen the preview i would have seen the twist at the end ( obviously they didn't think the show needed a twist? ) who knows, I think the people marketing the film are the ones to blame for the poor reviews and revenue return.

Not the worst thing Eddie has done.

I've read the no so complimenting reviews, and I have no idea what in this movie is bad. I go to a movie to enjoy myself, and this movie was indeed a good surprise. It has visual effects, music not so bad, good actors, and a usual story but in an interesting environment. The movie tried to bring a popular script to the future. I enjoyed the movie, much better, light, then other movies today. Eddie Murphy is not disappointing as always, his movies as well as this one are a all family movie to go and just enjoy it. In my opinion, even the robot scenes are somewhat novel, in contrast to other reviews.

Eddie Murphy's comic appeal is fading out, and if he will not do something special soon, his carrier will be over. The problem may be in the scripts and directors he is picking. 'Pluto Nash' is not much more than a TV pilot, but you will not see the series soon, because they did not catch with the audience. Effects are like Star Trek in the 70s. The only bright spots are Rosario Dawson - better and more beautiful in each movie, and Randy Quaid, acting good, though his robot humor is quite expected. But so is the humor in the whole movie, and you do not get much more cinema satisfaction than you do watching some TV comedy. Actually I saw many better TV ones. 6/10 on my personal scale.

While there have been better movies, there have certainly been worse. This movie is a reasonably harmless way to kill a couple hours and, considering what has been on TV and cable lately, it might well be worth your while to rent this one. Besides, any time we get the chance to see the lovely Pam Grier (I still can't believe she's been around Hollywood for 30 years now!) it's worth the rental fee. Pywrit scale of 1-10, I give this one a 6.
Wow what a great laugh . what wrong with it some critics need to have laugh
WTF 3.8 in Ratings for this great movie!? I voted a 7 and i think its fair! its a movie to enjoy with Friends or Family, i dont spoil anything but: it got good Music too :-)

review_title: Shoot me if you must, but I liked the movie.
review_detailed_main: Ok, let's face it, it's not an Academy Award winner, but Pluto Nash was a fun movie (catchy theme music too). I can't believe all the bashing this movie has taken, for a goofy fun movie...lighten up people and enjoy. Pluto Nash may not be Gone with the Wind, but it's also not Dude Where's my Car :-)

My wife and I love this movie and have watched it many times. Good clean action the whole family can enjoy. This movie has a great story and characters that are easy to like and root for. I would love to see another movie or TV show of Pluto Nash. If you liked,Princess Bride,5th Element or StarDust you will enjoy this movie.

review_title: Why is on the top 100 worst?

review_detailed_main:
I liked 'Pluto Nash'. The soundtrack was catchy and enhanced the story, the old-time gangster B-movie treatment of a moon base, complete with 40's and 50's inspired car styles, was great. The science of the story was interesting, and appropriate to the story, with nothing wild thrown in (well, maybe the highway port-o-let in vacuum in the first moon surface scene was a bit much).

The shootouts, the chases, and the robots (gotta love a bald Randy Quaid and 'Babette' -- "Oops!") If you want a gritty vision of future crime, check out 'Judge Dredd' -- for the 'Nuns on the Run' type criminals, Pluto is your man!

review_title: A film ahead of its time
review_detailed_main: The Adventures of Pluto Nash are exactly that, an adventure. You have action, you have romance, and you have beautiful acting from the comedic genius Eddie Murphy. Randy Quaid as a robot was a lovable and heart wrenching addition to the film. I felt his pain at not being appreciated. I understood his loyalty and celebrated his triumphs. The technology and culture of the futuristic period was dead on with risky yet probable decisions by the producers. This film is clearly geared toward the highly intelligent. It took me several viewings to truly absorb its depth and message.

review_title: I liked this movie, it entertained me
review_detailed_main:
I found this movie to be thoroughly entertaining. I have no idea why this movie has such poor ratings. Maybe you just have to be a science fiction fan to enjoy it?

I like the entire outer space thing. Then there's the vehicles. The robot thing going on. I also don't think the acting is as bad as some people will have you believe.

I think it's a brilliant movie and I would gladly watch it again. I'm confused why this movie has such bad reviews. And according to the internet it was a bomb at the box office? Maybe people have no taste.

Over time maybe this can be considered a cult classic. Much like other entertaining films like Lifepod.

review_title: One of the worst films I've ever seen, it's just embarrasing

review_detailed_main: I thought it was under rated. I enjoyed it. It was no blockbuster but absollutley entertaining.

Watched this through tonight on UK's ITV1.. and thoroughly enjoyed it. Box office flop.. cost $100M to make, took $4.4M over what period of time.. the introduction makes you wonder, but once it gets going, its a romp!! Yes, many ideas stolen from other sci fi pics but then what film doesn't copy some things. Total Recall/Blade Runner came to mind. What new ideas are there anyway. The money must have gone on effects, and I thought they stood up very well. Yes, its a family film, don't remember any bad language in it, but this was a TV cut. Some great ideas in this,no mention of John Cleese in the write up, but its a cameo. By the end I realised I have seen it before. So I've forgotten it, enjoyed it all over again. Flop, well, many people seem to expect blood and gore now, shame. Is it the age group? Not funny? 'Humour chip' missing is it? Maybe its too subtle. Its a very sad state when people couldn't enjoy such a well made film.. as another comment said, accept it for what it is. Don't expect. So many good bits in it..some set pieces. Yes, Fifth Element as well to a degree.. I like Eddie Murphy as an actor, I love sci fi, whats wrong?

I love this movie. I don't understand the hate. It's an enjoyable Saturday afternoon movie. Anytime i come across,I have to stay till the end. Definitely a movie not to taken seriously. Just dumb fun,with a great sci-go bent. Even the movie doesn't take itself seriously. Dawson plays a character very similar to her role in Men in Black 2. Definitely not her best work but gets the job done. It's nice to see someone make a movie that breaks the norm and almost reminds of the old serials they played before the movie when I was younger,or should I say young. Lol. The old Flash Gordon and such. Would really recommend that they should make a big bowl of popcorn and give it a try. Maybe by themselves if their afraid of being teased. Give it a try,don't get all snobby and just have a dumb laugh.

review_title: I like this movie! Better than the bad ratings would lead you to believe!
review_detailed_main: If you like comedies and movies that you can just relax and not take seriously, this might be for you! If you like movies such as "Hudson Hawk" you might want to give this a look.

I avoided this movie for so long based on the fact that I'd heard so many critics panning it. Being an Eddie Murphy fan, and having seen every other film of his, curiosity got the better of me. I can confidently say, having now seen the movie, that while it isn't Murphy's best work, it's certainly far from his worst. Sure it's not the usual joke-a-minute Eddie Murphy affair, but does every Eddie Murphy movie have to be? This was a great little action sci-fi film with a suitable amount of comedy on the side. I encourage anyone who likes Eddie Murphy to give this film a shot, you'll be pleasantly surprised!

I really enjoyed Pluto Nash - Eddie Murphy was great! It had Randy Quaid and even Jay Mohr. It was funny and action-packed, and the effects/sci-fi were terrific. The jokes were NOT juvenile - they were wry and sometimes silly, but I don't remember any "Uranus" joke or other lame jokes. Even if there were, they were less than a handful, compared to the entire film which both entertained and had realistic Moon/sci-fi action. The director and special effects people did their homework. There were some weak points in the plot, such as some of Pluto's motives, but I understood the entire story. It's almost Beverly Hills Cop combined with Total Recall (and direct reference to both a Star Trek episode and Star Trek movie regarding identical people) but set on the Moon.

review_title: ignore the bad votes, this is actually a good movie
review_detailed_main:
** Contains spoilers ** I don't know why so many reviewers are giving this movie such low ratings, including those cretins that give out the Razzie awards. Some of them obviously have no idea what movie they're reviewing. This movie actually has good performances, good dialogue and very good visuals. It's certainly an order of magnitude better than puerile junk like "The Spy Who Shagged Me" which seems to get lots of high ratings.

There are, contrary to what some say, quite a few fresh ideas, e.g.: the guy who created a whole basketball team, by cloning one old player, called the Air Jordans or: if you're getting a body alteration, you get scanned and then pose in front of what looks like a mirror, with various new bodies or: illegally imported freeze-dried chihuahuas. Also, if one payed attention, the gravity situation is "explained" up front: the "Welcome to Little America" sign also notes "Prepare for Full Gravity". This is at least better than the apparently universal one-G gravitation found on every planet or moon in "Star Trek" or "Star Wars".

review_title: The movie was really fun to watch...
review_detailed_main:
Many people said that the movie has bad jokes or a weak story.

I don't think so. The jokes were great, the action cool, and the story twists unexpected.

I give it 8 out of 10.

Go and see for yourself. You won't be disappointed...

I heard only bad things about this movie so when it was showing on cable several months ago, my wife and I took no interests but got drawn in nevertheless.

The movie was a lot of fun! It was light, funny and full of clever small details about life on the Moon.

It is a shame that it was panned by the critics, the studio and the marketers. They were very good at destroying any chance of this entertaining movie succeding with the audience when the movie was finally released.

It is an absolute BS to say that this movie is bad. If you are seeking a bad movie go and watch "The League of Extraordnary Gentleman"

review_title: A Movie That Is Ahead Of Its Time.....
review_detailed_main:
Feels like a simple case of "POLITICS AS USUAL", when it comes to this movie. Looks like the critics and the "REALLY SENSITIVE" took this flick way too personal, because the only thing I see with this movie is teh "BALANCE OF POWER / CONTROL BASED ON ETHNICS".

A good movie, with an odd premise, but funny just the same. I would easily closely compare this one to the likes of "THE FIFTH ELEMENT, DEMOLITION MAN or TERMINATOR SERIES".

All of these movies have rediculous, or unbelievable subject matter, but entertaining just the same.

Timing also played a big part in this movie. I truly believe that had this movie been released at the right time, it could have made all the difference.

The entire cast and crew were GREAT! I especially enjoyed the little things, (details that mattered), which laced the entire movie together.

The only thing I see here is that prevous movies Eddie Murphy starred seemed to shoot for a younger audience, where as this movie was set in the future, it used a number of actors from an older age group. (That is probably what attracted me).

I guess if its all about the bottom line, ($$$ Cha-Ching $$$), one must be more aware of the market they are targeting by using newer names (perhaps), while also being aware who has the power or control in the movie.

Its all good! All about "Entertainmant"..... (Just a movie). Some day there might become a time when our society, as a whole, can actually complete a movie that would meet or exceed the sensitivities of at least the majority of its viewers.

;<)

review_title: One Of My Favorite Fallback Movies Of All Time
review_detailed_main: I can not tell you how many times I have watched this movie! is it Eddie Murphy of old (when he had to prove himself?) No! (do you really think an actor should limit himself to what people want him to be?) Is it Eddie Murphy entertaining himself? well... it quite possibly could be! in any case, stop looking at his movies for what he used to be, and appreciate the man for what he is!! this movie was brilliant in a lot of different ways that simply are not "Eddie Murphy" I for one am glad he got rid of that old personification and made movies like this and Coming to America! (I think the world is much richer with them) and it's marvelous to watch an actor grow! (even if you don't think its what he should be growing into)

review_title: I was surprised by how much I enjoyed this movie!
review_detailed_main:
Pluto Nash is not for the brainiac in us.I did find it an amusing and playful movie that I would recommend seeing.

I read the reviews in the papers and on the web and I can tell you that the critics who get paid are wrong again. They seem to have gotten their noses bent out of joint by not being allowed to screen the movie before everyone else.

For those of us writing reviews on the web, we seem to be a confused lot. Half of us like it and half don't. I went expecting a B grade Sci-Fi with cheesy Eddie Murphy jokes and enjoyed myself throughly. It's actually one of the better movies I've seen recently, believe it or not, mostly because it's not pretending to be something it's not, and then failing miserably.

I wouldn't recommend this one for the kids, not that there is much sex/violence, but more for the fact that the humour is just stuff that kids won't find funny. (I must be feeling my age. :)

Don't go to this movie if you want great Sci-fi, don't go if you want great comedy, but I recommend it for those of you who just want to be entertained without a lot of thought!

review_title: Don't judge this movie by the rating
review_detailed_main: Seriously, it doesn't suck. Somehow I missed seeing this when it came out, I would have been into it. I really enjoyed this movie and for it being 18 years old already, it holds up for the most part. Classic feel good Eddie Murphy paired with Rosario Dawson and a touch of Randy Quaid... yes please. I will probably watch it again on a rainy day.

review_title: The funniest sci-fi movie that starred Eddie Murphy!!

review_detailed_main: It is chock full of great actors and actresses that compliment Eddie Murphy in this fun romp on the moon. It is not as risque as his other movies of the time. It is toned down a bit which makes it a bit better. It is a great movie that has never received its due.
This movie was no where near as bad as the ratings say. Very clever with many very funny situations...plus some good one liners. Well worth the time to watch. I thoroughly enjoyed it

review_title: One of the FEW Major Black Actors in a Sci-Fi, KICKIN!
review_detailed_main:
As a long term fan of Eddie Murphy, ( From SNL ), It was a great thing to see him take on a diverse role, especially in a Science Fiction Movie.

With Sci-Fi Movies being my favorite genra, right next to comedy, It was great to see many of my favorite actors, ( Even the new ones ), bringing it all together, but this time in outer space.

Cannot unterstand why the movie did not do as well as it did in the theaters. Feels like "politics", but perhaps it could have been "Timing".

Eddie playing "a suave and sophisticated bar owner on the moon", seems like a pretty cool foundation a movie, especially when you add a razy side kick like "Randy Quaid" as a robot.

Then the movie takes it back to more "old school" with the infamous "Blacksploitation Actress", PAM GRIER. ( Looking as good as ever ), and especially tough while helping to run down the bad guys. (Pam is still all that)!

My first introduction to Mr. Boyle was in the De Nero movie, (Taxi Driver). Through the years he has done an awesome job in both areas of comedy, (Gege Wilder / Mel Brooks), to dramas.

The casting was like something sent down from "The Movie Gods". Not to mention that "Whacky Assed Jay Mohr", who played behind a Celebrity name I have not heard of since the 60s, (Tony Francis)..... Heh, Heh...

Over all, the movie did well! My perspective is from looking at black actors from the "Stepin' Fetchit" era, up to present. I view this movie as "A DEFINITE STEP FORWARD", and perhaps with a different chemistry, (Viewing the down falls of this movie), one should take all elements into consideration, and just "DO IT AGAIN!!!!"

Hats off to all involved in this venture. Lets, again, contribute an even larger positive lead by evolving the acting spectrum, as a whole!

Also, would love to see Jacynthe Rene` (Babette), again but in an expanded role. She has a lot of potential acting in American movies;<)

From the words of Eddie Murphy himself: "Its All Good"! My favorite saying, only because its true.

Tony M. FiveDolphins

review_title: The sets, the goofiness, the lines, the story are all very good.
review_detailed_main: I watched this movie on TV on demand and thoroughly enjoyed it. Eddie Murphy, as usual, was excellent and the rest of the cast was just as good. I loved the sets, the goofiness, the lines, the story. Since I found myself wanting to re watch the movie I bought the DVD and the movie now stands on my shelf, next to my other favorites. Critics can be wrong. For example, back in the 1950s, "Imitation of Life", now recognized as a cinematographic masterpiece, was unanimously panned by the critics! This is just one example. Personally, I make it a point never to read them before watching a film. Instead, I check out the director, the cast and maybe the story. If I know neither director nor cast I use my own critical judgment based on the story, what my movie - savvy friends say and a general feel based on trailers. I might read the critics after seeing a film to see who I agree with or rather, who agrees with me. By unanimously panning The Adventures of Pluto Nash the critics have committed another Great Critic Blunder. The movie is really very good.

This was a great movie. I don't know why everyone gave it a harsh review. It had action and comedy, a perfect mix. The robot was hilarious. The jokes went great along the story. A masterpiece waiting to be watch. 10/10.

This movie, like Battlefield Earth and Speedracer are just unfortunate victims of groupthink stupidity. One idiot says its bad on their sad little blog and every other critic wannabe just hops on board and slams it for no reason. I missed seeing this in theaters because I only heard how bad it was. I saw it years later on tv and loved it! Its FRESH and ORIGINAL and FUNNY. I completely loathe critics now. Especially these days when the brain dead lemmings will rant and rave about the stupidest crap (like some dumbass muscle heads strapping rockets to a car and going into space, or a bunch of lame cgi super heros jumping around in slow motion). Its why movies these days just suck!

Advance comments would have you believe this is some horrid

hybrid of Holy Man and 2001:A Space Travesty. It's actually a pleasant action movie with comic tones, sly touches and a nice

twist.. The trailer doesn't do it justice. I mainly went to see the

pairing of Eddie Murphy and John Cleese, two comic geniuses

with different approaches. I suppose if Jack Black was the star it

would be hailed as a comic masterpiece by those who think

hearing the word "Malkovich" over and over again denotes genius. A good Saturday afternoon escapist feature and I did not hear the "Uranus" joke so take that to mean what you will.

review_title: Add cheesy luv sick teens and ppl would love it
review_detailed_main: One of the best feel good movies I've ever seen. Set in space which I love, a space hustler / club owner has a series of misadventures. They actually used some imagination for this film, cool characters and different future techs. I loved the advanced Moon Cadillac lol just awesome. Not sure what ppl expected with this movie I'm guessing it's just because Eddie Murphy was in it that ppl must have expected some huge belly busting block buster. That is not what this movie is, it is a light hearted comedy set in space (the Moon). I really liked the original characters with the quirky personality's of the machines (IE robot, Cadillac) If your looking for a sci-fi scene with some good laughs and funny characters this movie is for you!

review_title: I was pleasantly surprised for ONE reason...
Lunar Las Vegas With Fun Science Fiction
review_detailed_main: Fun theme music and some playful thoughts about life in the future (the Lunar Grand Hotel, instant plastic surgery, the hillarious [sic] new face of money, and so on) punctuate this action adventure. Pluto Nash (Eddie Murphy) is the owner of a nightclub on the moon which has apparently been settled Las Vegas style by the time the movie begins. His adventures occur as he goes about protecting his interests and his existence from the underworld figures who are trying to muscle in on his turf. Dina Lake (Rosario Dawson, also seen in Men In Black II) makes for an attractive cohort. Bruno (Randy Quaid) is an unexpectedly sympathetic android character. Some will appreciate the rather enjoyable exterior scenes of lunar habitats and Earthrise moonscapes. It's just a movie, folks, but if you're in the right mood, it's entertaining.

review_title: Not really that bad, but still a long way from great
Not a single laugh to be had, leaving the clunky and unengaging plot exposed throughout
I thought Pluto Nash was a great movie!
review_detailed_main: I honestly don't know why all these critic "SNOB'S" get listened to.? Judge the movie on your own! Let no one tell you how you should feel about The Adventures of Pluto Nash. I Honestly thought it was unique, light hearted, inventive, yes a bit silly, but SO what? It was a lot of fun and it had a very good ending. I think all of you out there giving this movie such a hard time need to stop taking yourselves entirely to seriously. Lighten up!:) I have read a lot of comments, and reviews on movies such as Megaforce. This movie was the same as Pluto Nash. fun, Unique, and after all is said and done light hearted. Like Puto Nash it had a great if a little over the top story line. You should look up some of the reviews. However I suggest you see the movie for yourself first. Remember It was made In what 1979-80? movie technology wasn't quite where it it today (except for the Lucas's and Spielburg's) of the world, but they did the best with what they had. I Just believe most of these movie critics are just venting their own frustration at having nothing better to do. So there being as mean as they possibly can.

I don't know why this movie got such horrible reviews. True, its not Oscar worthy, but still I enjoyed the movie for what it is; a ridiculous cheesy comedy. But I enjoyed it and whenever I'm feeling down I watch it. That's all I have to say on this movie.

review_title: Not horrendous but definitely not memorable
Best future since Back To The Future part II
review_detailed_main:
This has got to be one of the only movies I've seen (aside from Back To The Future II) where the future is portrayed in a fun and exciting way, rather than the more common dark future, such as Minority Report, Blade Runner, etc. Just the sets and technicalities of the movie are worth seeing it on alone.

But I also found some parts absolutely hilarious! The whole thing wasn't a laugh a minute, but I'd definitely recommend it. Heck, just writing this makes me wanna go see it again.

In short, this is a fun movie, which you should catch if it's ever on TV. The story isn't bad either, it really reminds you of the family movies made in the late 80s early 90s. If you're looking for some excellently written piece of bore, then you won't enjoy it. But if you wanna see a hilarious, colorful adventure in space, definitely see it.

review_title: Pluto Nash, The Jesus Christ of Our Times
review_detailed_main: The Adventures of Pluto Nash has simply been the most influential movie that I've ever seen. I had depression when it came out, it cured it. My dad had stage four testicular cancer, it cured it. Me and my wife couldn't get it on, and Eddie Murphy personally came to my house, in character, and done did my wife. Needless to say, we haven't been happier since. I can't even begin to describe what Pluto Nash has done for my life. I hope and pray to god that everybody watches The Adventures of Pluto Nash in their lifetimes.

review_title: Eddie Murphy himself panned this movie.

review_detailed_main:
i got this movie on the discount shelf because the cast seemed promising. i expected it to be pretty trashy and was pleasantly surprised. it was a fun science fiction, some interesting visuals like the grime, the cars, the interior spaces, the moonwalks and the city. i also liked the way that the artificial moon life was represented in opposition to the natural earth (reminded me of a low budget Bladerunner). I thought that the humor was amusing if not always funny and the dialogue pretty good. i also liked the role reversals such as the kick ass Pam Grier mom and for once, a black character plays a hero in sci-fi instead of just being some mechanic or sidekick or the first-to-die victim.

as some other commenters have written, if you're expecting eddie murphy to be the clown, you'll be disappointed. expect low budget, entertaining, slightly transgressive, sexy eddie murphy sci-fi.

review_title: This movie is simply a masterpiece
Soundtrack is the best thing here
review_detailed_main:
10 out of 10 - But only for the soundtrack!!!!!! That is..

The soundtrack (by John Powell) is the only good thing about this movie.

And guess what.....WB won't release the license for the release of the Score because it WAS such a FLOP!!!! That really is a SIN.

Y the hell sacrifice an absolutely WICKED Score just because they think the film wasn't viewed by enough people (at the cinema maybe) but general viewing over the airwaves, cable and DVD....there must be more! I'm also sure that Mr.Powell wasn't too happy about the S.track not getting a release either.

I want to see a RELEASE A.S.A.P.

or even a bootleg...does not bother me!!

In 2002, Eddie Murphy delivered one of his most polarizing performances in the science-fiction comedy "The Adventures of Pluto Nash". Hailed by some as a major misstep, and universally panned by critics, the film has since developed a cult following of those who believe it to be a misunderstood gem.

Murphy's eccentric style was in full display in his portrayal of Pluto Nash, an ex-smuggler turned nightclub owner on the moon. With an intricately woven narrative that dives into themes of economic manipulation and artificial intelligence, the film boldly confronts complex topics through a comedic lens.

"The Adventures of Pluto Nash" indeed suffered from a severe disconnect with audiences at the time of its release, making it a significant box-office flop. However, the film's ambitious approach to comedy and storytelling, set against the backdrop of a futuristic moon colony, sets it apart from the traditional comedy fare.

One of the film's defining features is its refusal to take itself too seriously. From the tongue-in-cheek future tech to the moon's multicultural denizens to the unabashedly campy special effects, it all adds up to a film that's more farce than hardcore sci-fi, which may have rubbed some viewers the wrong way upon its initial release.

However, the audience is rewarded when they approach the film with an open mind, free from preconceived notions. Despite its commercial failure, "The Adventures of Pluto Nash" features a standout comedic performance from Eddie Murphy and a unique blend of humor and sci-fi that is truly its own.

In conclusion, "The Adventures of Pluto Nash" is an underrated and delightful film that balances its eccentric comedy with unexpected depth. Its initial box office failure should not dissuade potential viewers from giving it a chance. Over time, it may just prove to be a hidden treasure in Murphy's illustrious filmography.

review_title: Forget the movie, watch it for the score
A financial disaster, but not the worst Eddie has to offer
THE MOON REALLY IS MADE OF CHEESE
The rise and downfall of Eddie Murphy
They sure know how to bury a film.
